DataElement.preferredName: Derived Last Follow-Up Contact Less Surgical Procedure Date Calculated Month Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of last follow-up to the date of surgery, represented as a calculated number of months.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Last Follow-Up Subtraction Surgical Procedure Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._The act of removing a part from the whole._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
The period of time during which something continues.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
